item.title: Array Help
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your error in specific is because of the Misc.random method.
amount.length = 10

Java starts counting at 0.

So the Misc.random(amount.length) can return 0-10.
And if it returns 10, it will give an out of bounds exception.
You need to do amount.length - 1.

Next, there’s no reason that you have the array in two places. You should have the array one time, in one class. And since the array is never modified, it can be declared as a constant.

^You should also make sure your array name is related to what it does.

Read full topic

item.title: Array Help
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

I am trying to add rewards to impling jars on my rsps, and I am using arrays. Here is an example of my code.

player.java

itemclick2.java

final int[] amount ={751, 87610, 12000, 1251212, 437867, 124121, 124, 2451, 1257411, 3000000};case 11256: if(c.getItems().freeSlots() >= 2) { c.getItems().deleteItem(11256, 1); c.getItems().addItem(995, amount[Misc.random(amount.length)]); c.sendMessage("you have looted the impling jar."); } else c.sendMessage("You must have atleast 2 inventory slots free to loot the impling jar!"); break;

This is just my one code for the dragon imp jar, but it gives me a “java.lang.arrayindexoutofboundsexception: 10” error randomly while looting the jars. I realize it is a problem with the array, as it says in the error, but I can’t figure out what I am doing wrong.

Read full topic
